item.description:
Proposal : Backyard Astronomy : Two Part Workshop with indoor presentations and outdoor observing if the weather permits. Course length 2 hour sessions with a 15 minute break between sessions. Dates : Thursday January 10th and Thursday January 17th at 6:30 PM.
Each workshop ends at 8:45 PM. Tower Hill is an amazing spot to hold a meetup - it has an excellent indoor theater plus an outdoor area where telescopes can easily be set up for observing! This is a two day workshop - we want everyone to have a good opportunity for a personal observing and learning experience!
Fee : call Tower Hill to reserve a spot => www.towerhillbg.org
There is a small fee to help defray expenses for keeping Tower Hill open at night.
Donations : Will be accepted for the Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc new Public Observatory that will be handicap accessible and sponsor STEM activities for outh and teachers. ( STEM - Science, Technology, Engineering and Math! )
Presenter : Jim J. Zebrowski , President Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc., NASA/JPLSolar Ambassador and Oxford Astronomy Meetup Group Organizer
Overview : This short two day workshop will allow participants learn to find and identify objects in the night sky from their own backyard. They will be able to identify major constellations, asterisms, major stars, learn some astronomical night sky lore, understand basic astronomical concepts and learn about breaking news in astronomical research and space exploration.
Challenge your imagination – a user friendly introduction to learning about your place in the Universe!
The Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc. will provide telescopes and binoculars to allow participants to view night sky objects. Participants will be encouraged to acquire inexpensive planispheres and are advised to dress warm for any outdoor observing session. Additional handouts will be provided as memory guides to help with all concepts discussed throughout the course.
Content : All sessions offer outdoor observing, weather permitting!
1. The Night Sky : Understanding the dome of the sky over your head!
Backyard Astronomy Basics – Using the internet as a learning guide
Starhopping : Star patterns : Constellations and asterisms
The Ecliptic
2. Welcome to the New Solar System – your informal guide to the eight planets, five dwarf planets, asteroids, comets along with the Kuiper Belt and Oort Cloud.
3. The basics of observing and enjoying the daytime and night sky!
Using Planispheres
Binoculars vs Telescopes : Basic Principles
Understanding Lunar Phases
Handouts about basic astronomy - an easy introduction to encourage attendees to want to learn more about their universe and to find objects from their Backyard! Have fun - sign up and bring your imagination! Remember - you need to contact Tower Hill directly if you plan to attend in addition to sending the Meetup Organzer your plan to attend!
